page.title: 11THE ORIGIN OF FAIR OAK
page.content: The village stands at the junction of roads from Eastleigh, Botley and Winchester. At this road junction was an old oak tree and it was around this tree that a village fair used to be held. That is how the place got it's name. It was once the custom for the first stall-holder to erect his stall to call at The Old George Inn. He had to knock at the side door and ask the landlord, Mr. White for the key of the fair. Then all the stall-holders would take the key to the front door and exchange it for a gallon of ale. The key, The Old George and an oak tree are still in existence but the fair is no longer held. The present tree is about 90 years old and replaces a tree thought to have been pushed down on July 27th 1842 when it was about 150 years old.
